Go to grants & support to apply

"The Movement for Change programme gave Legacy Active Communities a space to focus on building for the future as we support schools and communities to encourage health and physical activity in young people's everyday lives. With likeminded social entrepreneurs, we could address challenges and opportunities for our social enterprise, while discussing our business models and opportunities for growth. We experienced considered, strategic, expert feedback on diversification opportunities - including risk and reward - to bolster our operations and greaten our social impact."

Shaun Fox
CEO, Legacy Active Communities
Movement for Change Pilot

Partners and Funders

Millennium Awards Trust

Grants

Starting up

Up to £8,000

Can grant be used for social entrepreneur salary? No
Can grant be used for social venture costs? Yes
Support
Dedictaed support managerSomeone to coach, mentor and support you to achieve your goals. Yes
Expert mentors and pro bono supportExpert advice and mentoring through our generous community of business professionals, corporate partners and social entrepreneurs who volunteer their skills and expertise. Yes
Workshops and learningThrough our regular workshops and support you will be able to learn about different aspects of running a social venture. Yes
Eligibility
Social entrepreneur A social entrepreneur is the name we give to people who have started, or looking to start, a social venture, someone who is driven by their passion to make a difference. They are looking to make a sustained and long-term impact and need our funding and support to make it happen.
How old are you? 16 years old or older
Where are you resided? England
Social venture A social entrepreneur is the name we give to people who have started, or looking to start, a social venture, someone who is driven by their passion to make a difference. They are looking to make a sustained and long-term impact and need our funding and support to make it happen.
  • Must not employ others to undertake most of the work.
  • Must not involve political or religious campaigning.
  • Must not predominantly focus on raising awareness of social issues.
How long has your social venture been selling goods and services? Not yet or less than 1 year
How long has your social venture been incorporated? Not yet or less than 4 years
Where is your social venture located? England
Is your social venture already having an impact? Not yet or yes
What is your social ventures impact areas?
    (1 or more)
  • Physical wellbeing
  • Mental wellbeing
  • Personal development
  • Economic development
  • Social and community development
Where is your social venture having the majority of its impact? England
How much did you earn last financial year? Under £250,000
Which opportunities is your social venture working withmarginalised people in? Sports/physical activity

Support

Expert mentors and pro bono supportExpert advice and mentoring through our generous community of business professionals, corporate partners and social entrepreneurs who volunteer their skills and expertise. Included in Starting up Included in Scaling up
Workshops and learningThrough our regular workshops and support you will be able to learn about different aspects of running a social venture. Included in Starting up Included in Scaling up
Eligibility
Social entrepreneurA social entrepreneur is the name we give to people who have started, or looking to start, a social venture, someone who is driven by their passion to make a difference. They are looking to make a sustained and long-term impact and need our funding and support to make it happen.
How old are you? 16 years old or older 16 years old or older
Where are you resided? England England
Social venture A social venture is an organisation driven by social purpose to create impact and has a financially sustainable business model to continue to make a difference. It sits in between a commercial business and a charity, often described as 'profit for purpose'.
  • Must not employ others to undertake most of the work.
  • Must not involve political or religious campaigning.
  • Must not predominantly focus on raising awareness of social issues.
How long has your social venture been selling goods and services? Not yet or less than 1 year 1 to 4 years
How long has your social venture been incorporated? Not yet or less than 4 years Less than 4 years
Where is your social venture located? England England
Is your social venture already having an impact? Not yet or yes Yes
What is your social ventures impact areas?
    (1 or more)
  • Physical wellbeing
  • Mental wellbeing
  • Personal development
  • Economic development
  • Social and community development
 		(1 or more)
  • Physical wellbeing
  • Mental wellbeing
  • Personal development
  • Economic development
  • Social and community development
Where is your social venture having the majority of its impact? England England
How much did you earn last financial year? Under £250,000 Under £250,000
Which opportunities is your social venture working with marginalised people in? Sports/physical activity Sports/physical activity

Inclusion

At least 50% of those supported by Movement for Change will be from Black, Asian, marginalised ethnic groups or disabled backgrounds

Movement for Change is dedicated to pushing inclusion in the wider sector and beyond, seeking to address systemic inequalities by highlighting the experiences of underrepresented social entrepreneurs and sharing our learning in devising solutions

We want to make it clear that at UnLtd that when we support LGBTQIA+ organisations, we welcome and support trans people, non-binary, gender diverse, genderqueer and gender questioning people. When we support organisations focusing on women's issues and rights, we include trans women. When we support organisations focusing on men's issues, we include trans men. We are committed to using an intersectional lens on social issues, and our own learning.

Learn more about LQBTQIA+ equity commitments Learn more about equity commitments

Help

For social entrepreneurs with questions about Movement for Change, please reach out via our Contact Us page.
